gurmukhi: ਜਲ ਜੇਛਣ ਹੈਂ || ਪ੍ਰਣ ਪੇਛਣ ਹੈਂ || ਅਰ ਮਰਦਨ ਹੈਂ || ਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਕਰਦਨ ਹੈਂ ||੩੫੩||
transliteration: Jal Jechhan Hain|| Pran Pechhan Hain|| Ar(i) Ghaaik Hain|| Mrit Kardan Hain||353||
translation: He is the Yaksha of water and the fulfiller of the promise; He is the Destroyer of the enemy and the masher of his pride.353.

gurmukhi: ਧਰਣੀਧਰ ਹੈਂ || ਕਰਣੀ ਕਰ ਹੈਂ || ਧਨ ਕਰਖਨ ਹੈਂ || ਸਰ ਬਰਖਨ ਹੈਂ ||੩੫੪||
transliteration: Dharnee-dhar Hain|| Karnidar Hain|| Dhan Karkhan Hain|| Sar Barkhan Hain||354||
translation: He is the creator and support of the earth and by pulling His bow, He showers the arrows.354.

gurmukhi: ਛਟ ਛੈਲ ਪ੍ਰਭਾ || ਲਖਿ ਚੰਦ ਲਭਾ || ਛਬ ਸੋਹਤ ਹੈਂ || ਤ੍ਰੀਯ ਮੋਹਤ ਹੈਂ ||੩੫੫||
transliteration: Chhat Chhail Prabhaa|| Lakh(i) Channd Labhaa|| Chhah Sohat Hain|| Treeya Mohat Hain||355||
translation: He glorious with the elegance of lakhs of moons; He is the Fascinatior of women with His Glorious Elegance.355.

gurmukhi: ਅਰਣੰ ਬਰਣੰ || ਧਰਣੰ ਧਰਣੰ || ਹਰਿ ਸੀ ਕਰਿ ਭਾ || ਸੁ ਸੁਭੰਤ ਪ੍ਰਭਾ ||੩੫੬||
transliteration: Arnan Barnan|| Dharnan Dharnan|| Har(i) Sikar(i) Bhaa|| Su Soubhant Prabhaa||356||
translation: He has red colour, He supports the Earth and has infinite Glory.356.

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਰਣਾਲਯ ਹੈਂ || ਅਰ ਘਾਲਯ ਹੈਂ || ਛਟ ਛੈਲ ਘਨੇ || ਅਤਿ ਰੂਪ ਸਨੇ ||੩੫੭||
transliteration: Sharnaalaya Hain|| Ar Ghalaya Hain|| Chhat Chhail Ghane|| At(i) Roop Sane||357||
translation: He is the field of Refuge, the Killer of the enemy, Most Glorious and Most Charming.357.

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਮੋਹਤ ਹੈਂ || ਛਬ ਸੋਹਤ ਹੈਂ ਕਲ ਕਾਰਨ ਹੈਂ || ਕਰੁਣਾ ਧਰ ਹੈਂ ||੩੫੮||
transliteration: Man Mohat Hain|| Chhab Sohat Hain|| Kal Kaaran Hain|| Karounaa Dhar Hain||358||
translation: His Beauty captivates he mind; He is the Cause of the causes of the world and is Full of Mercy.358.

gurmukhi: ਅਤਿ ਰੂਪ ਸਨੇ || ਜਨੁ ਮੈਨੁ ਬਨੇ || ਅਤਿ ਕ੍ਰਾਂਤ ਧਰੇ || ਸਸਿ ਸੋਭ ਹਰੇ ||੩੫੯||
transliteration: At(i) Roop Sane|| Jan(u) Main(u) Bane|| At(i) Kraant Ddare|| Sas(i) Sobh Dare||359||
translation: He is of such Captivating Beauty as if He is the god of love; His Brightness defeats the moon’s glory.359.

gurmukhi: ਅਸਯ ੳੁਪਾਸਿਕ ਹੈਂ || ਅਰਿ ਨਾਸਿਕ ਹੈਂ || ਬਰ ਦਾੲਿਕ ਹੈਂ || ਪ੍ਰਭ ਪਾੲਿਕ ਹੈਂ ||੩੬੦||
transliteration: Asya Oupaasik Hain|| Ar(i) Naasik Hain|| Bar Daaik Hain|| Prabh Paaik Hain||360||
translation: He is the worshipper of the sword and the Destroyer of the enemy; He is the Lord bestower of the boon.360.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬੀਰੰ ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜੂਟੇ || ਤਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਤੀਰੰ ਛਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਛੂਟੇ || ਸਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਸੁਅਾਰੰ ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜੂਝੇ || ਕਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਕੋਪੇ ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ || ਰੂਝੇ ||੩੬੧||
transliteration: Baagaddan Bderan Jaagaddan Jeete|| Taagaddan Tderan Chhaadaddan Chhodhte|| Saagaddan Suaaran Jaagaddan Joojhe|| Kaagaddan Kope Raagaddan Roojhe||361||
translation: The warriors are fighting in the war and the arrows are being discharged; the horse-riders are fighting in the battlefield and in their fury, they are absorbed in fighting.361.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਮਾਚਿਓ ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜੁੱਧੰ || ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜੋਧਾ ਕਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਕ੍ਰੁੱਧੰ || ਸਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਸਾਂਗੰ ਡਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਡਾਰੇ || ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬੀਰੰ ਅਾਗੜਦੰਗ ੳੁਤਾਰੇ ||੩੬੨||
transliteration: Maagaddan Maachio Jaagaddan Joukkhan|| Jaagaddan Jodhaa Kaagaddan Kruddan|| Saagaddan|| Saanadg Daagaddan Ddare|| Baagaddan Bderan Aagaddan Outdare||362||
translation: The dreadful fighting continues and the warriors have got enraged; the warriors are striking their lances and are dismounting the fighters from their horses.362.

gurmukhi: ਤਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਤੈ ਕੈ ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜੁਅਾਣੰ || ਛਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਛੋਰੈ ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬਾਣੰ || ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜੂਝੇ ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬਾਜੀ || ਡਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਡੋਲੈ ਤਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਤਾਜੀ ||੩੬੩||
transliteration: Tagaddan Tai Kai Jaagaddan Juaanan|| Chhaadaddan Chhodhai Baagaddan Baanan|| Jaagaddan Jaajhe Baagaddan Baajee|| Daagaddan Dolai Taagaddan Taaj||363||
translation: The soldiers have discharged the arrows and the horses have been killed and the fast-moving horses jumped and ran away.363.

gurmukhi: ਖਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਖੂਨੀ ਖਯਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਖੇਤੰ || ਝਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਝੂਝੈ ਅਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਅਚੇਤੰ || ਅਾਗੜਦੰਗ ੳੁੱਠੇ ਕਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਕੋਪੇ || ਡਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਡਾਰੇ ਧਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਧੋਪੇ ||੩੬੪||
transliteration: Khadganndan Khoonikhuaagaddan Khetan|| Jhaagaddan Jhnjhai Aagaddan Achetan|| Aagaddan Outthe Kaagaddan Kope|| Dagaddan Ddare Dhaagaddan Dhope||364||
translation: The battlefield was saturated with blood and the warriors became unconscious during their fight; the fighters arise, get enraged and strike blows in great excitement.364.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਨਾਚੇ ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰੁਦ੍ਰੰ || ਭਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਭਾਜੇ ਛਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਛੁਦ੍ਰੰ || ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜੁੱਝੇ ਵਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਵੀਰੰ || ਲਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਲਾਗੇ ਤਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਤੀਰੰ ||੩੬੫||
transliteration: Naagaddan Naache Raagaddan Rudran|| Bhaagaddan Bhaaje Chhaadaddan Chhudran|| Jaagaddan Jujjhe Vaagaddan Vderan|| Laagaddan Laage Taagaddan Tderan||365||
translation: Shiva is dancing and the cowards are running away; the warriors are fighting and are being struck by the arrows.365.
